channel.name: WIFIErrorStatus
channel.comment: Returned Error code of WIFI chip

item.name: INVALID_PARAMETER
item.comment: This error code indicates that a command contained an invalid parameter

item.name: DEVICE_WRONG_STATE
item.comment: This error code indicates that the device is in wrong state to accept commands.

item.name: OUT_OF_MEMORY
item.comment: This error indicates that the device has run out of memory.

item.name: FEATURE_NOT_IMPLEMENTED
item.comment: This error indicates that the feature in question has not been implemented.

item.name: COMMAND_NOT_RECOGNIZED
item.comment: This error indicates that the issued command was not recognized.

item.name: TIMEOUT
item.comment: This error indicates that a command or procedure failed due to timeout.This error code is generated e.g. if you send an incomplete command to the Wi-Fi module - after the timeout of 1 second this error code is sent to the host transported by the event .endpoint_syntax_errorThis error code is generated also e.g. when the maximum number of retry attempts (10) to try to connect to a wireless network have been executed. A typical example of such a case might be when the issued password is invalid, in which case the error code is transported by the event .wifi_evt_sme_connect_failed

item.name: UNSPECIFIED_ERROR
item.comment: This error code is generated when an unspecified error is detected.

item.name: HARDWARE_FAILURE
item.comment: This error code is generated when a hardware failure is detected.

item.name: INTERNAL_BUFFER_FULL
item.comment: This error code is generated the a command was not accepted due to full internal buffers.

item.name: DISCONNECTED
item.comment: This error code is generated when a command or procedure has failed due to disconnection.

item.name: TOO_MANY_REQUEST
item.comment: This error code is generated when there are too many simultaneous requests.

item.name: ACCESS_POINT_NOT_IN_SCANLIST
item.comment: This error code is generated when the defined Access Point is not found from the scanlist.

item.name: INVALID_PASSWORD
item.comment: This error code is generated in the following cases:1) you try to connect to a secured network without setting the password or the password is too short2) you try to start a secured AP without setting the password or the password is too short3) you try to set a 64-character PSK with non-hex characters4) you try to set an invalid WEP key (invalid characters or invalid length)Notice that WPA does not contain any standard way for the Access Point to communicate to the station that the password is invalid. The Access Point just disconnects the client during authentication if the password is found invalid. Some stations take an educated guess that this probably means the password is incorrect. WF121 simply retries the authentication until it exceeds the maximum amount of retries (10) which then causes the 0x0185 Timeout Error.

item.name: AUTHENTIFICATION_FAILURE
item.comment: This error code is generated when the WPA/WPA2 authentication has failed.

item.name: OVERFLOW
item.comment: This error code is generated when an overflow has been detected.

item.name: MULTIPLE_PBC_SESSIONS
item.comment: This error code is generated when multiple PBC (Push Button Configuration) sessions have been detected.

item.name: ETHERNET_NOT_CONNECTED
item.comment: This error code is generated when the Ethernet cable is not connected

item.name: ETHERNET_ROUTE_NOT_SET
item.comment: This error code is generated if the Ethernet route is not set

item.name: WRONG_OPERATING_MODE
item.comment: This error code is generated if the operating mode is wrong for the issued command

item.name: WIFI_NOT_FOUND
item.comment: This error code is generated if the requested resource was not found.

item.name: WIFI_NOT_ALREADY_EXIST
item.comment: This error is generated if the requested resource already exists.

item.name: WIFI_INVALID_CONFIGURATION
item.comment: This error code is generated if the current configuration is invalid.

item.name: WIFI_ACCESS_POINT_LOST
item.comment: This error code is generated if the connection to an Access Point is lost.

item.name: PS_STORE_FULL
item.comment: This error is generated if the Flash which is reserved for the PS (Persistent Store) is full.

item.name: PS_KEY_NOT_FOUND
item.comment: This error is generated if the PS key (Persistent Store key) was not found.

item.name: I2C_WRITE_ALREADY_IN_PROGRESS
item.comment: This error is generated if I2C transmission was initiated while a transmission was already in progress.

item.name: I2C_ACK_MISSING
item.comment: This error is generated if an acknowledgement for I2C was not received.

item.name: FLASH_WRITE_FAILED
item.comment: This error code is generated if writing to Flash failed.

item.name: FILE_NOT_OPENED
item.comment: This error code is generated if an access was attempted to an unopened file.

item.name: FILE_NOT_FOUND
item.comment: This error code is generated if the requested file was not found in the SD card.

item.name: DISK_ERROR
item.comment: This error code is generated if an SD card error was detected of if the SD card is full

item.name: TCP_IP_SUCCESS
item.comment: This code indicates that no error was detected.

item.name: TCP_IP_OUT_OF_MEMORY
item.comment: This error code is generated when the system has run out of memory.

item.name: TCP_IP_BUFFER_ERROR
item.comment: This error code is generated when handling of buffers has failed

item.name: TCP_IP_TIMEOUT
item.comment: This error code is generated when a timeout has been detected.

item.name: TCP_IP_ROUTING
item.comment: This error code is generated when a route could not be found.

item.name: TCP_IP_IN_PROGRESS
item.comment: This error code is generated when an operation is in progress

item.name: TCP_IP_ILLEGAL_VALUE
item.comment: This error code is generated when the issued value is deemed illegal.

item.name: TCP_IP_WOULD_BLOCK
item.comment: This error code is generated when an operation blocks.

item.name: TCP_IP_ADDRESS_IN_USE
item.comment: This error code is generated when the issued address is already in use

item.name: TCP_IP_ALREADY_CONNECTED
item.comment: This error code is generated when the Wi-Fi module is already connected

item.name: TCP_IP_CONNECTION_ABORTED
item.comment: This error code is generated when a connection is aborted.

item.name: TCP_IP_CONNECTION_RESET
item.comment: This error code is generated when a connection has been reset

item.name: TCP_IP_CONNECTION_CLOSED
item.comment: This error code is generated when a connection has been closed.

item.name: TCP_IP_NOT_CONNECTED
item.comment: This error code is generated when the Wi-Fi module is not connected.

item.name: TCP_IP_ILLEGAL_ARGUMENT
item.comment: This error code is generated if an illegal argument was issued.

item.name: TCP_IP_INTERFACE_LEVEL_ERROR
item.comment: This error code is generated if an interface error was detected

item.name: TCP_IP_UNKNOWN_HOST
item.comment: This error is generated if an unknown host is detected.

item.name: SERVICE_NOT_RUNNING
item.comment: This error code is generated if the specified service is not running.

item.name: SERVICE_RUNNING
item.comment: This error code is generated if the specified service is already running

item.name: HOSTNAME_NOT_SET
item.comment: This error code is generated if the hostname has not been set

item.name: HOSTNAME_CONFLICT
item.comment: This error code is generated if a hostname conflict was detected.
